main event: An unidentified object was observed by a reliable witness who was a U.S. Marine, in Los Angeles, California on June 11, 1959.
interesting points: The object was described as round, the size of a softball, and made of dull aluminum.
The object hovered overhead and then headed northeast over the Paloma Mountains before making a 335 degree turn and disappearing.
The witness reported the object made a sound like a low-flying jet.
The sighting was confirmed by radar.
The report states there was no possible cause known to account for the unidentified flying object.
sighted object: round, softball-sized object made of dull aluminum
